medical_history.chief_complaint: Difficulty eating solid food and associated weight loss after an acute choking incident.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 14 days prior to evaluation after a piece of meat became stuck in an orthodontic palate expander. For the next 7 days, the patient had intense fear of swallowing, ate carefully, and decreased her food intake. On the 7th day post-incident, she stopped eating most solid foods, consuming only milkshakes and liquid dietary supplements. She reported inability to swallow small pieces of chicken and a single grain of rice, indicating worsening swallowing difficulty even after the palate expander was removed.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had a history of being a highly selective eater since infancy, with previous treatments for constipation. A prior administration of cyproheptadine for appetite issues was stopped after transient improvement due to side effects. No history of other significant medical conditions or ongoing medications was provided.
medical_history.family_history: There is a family history of depression.
medical_history.social_history: The patient lives with her parents and younger siblings. She is a student who does well academically and has many friends and hobbies.
